meaningMnemonic: A <radical>tsunami</radical> is coming, and you want to <radical>walk</radical> over it, so you have to <kanji>ford</kanji> it. You don’t walk across a tsunami, you <kanji>wade</kanji> across it.
readingMnemonic: Your ability to <kanji>ford</kanji> this tsunami impresses everyone who witnesses it, especially the <reading>Shou</reading>gun (しょう). Now that you've taught him a tsunami can be forded, he's going to start sending his troops through them instead of waiting for them to pass.
